did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Charles D. Wrege Collection of History of Management Photographs, 1879- 1996
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Charles "Chuck" Wrege finished his undergraduate degree in Upsala College, obtained his Masters degree at the New School fo Social Research and another Masters of Business Administration and his Ph.D. at NYU. He taught industrial management at Rutgers University for 30 years. He became a renowned historian, researcher and writer. He is regarded as a "National Treasure" by many in his field because of his expertise and the seminal research he has done in the area of management history.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Factory inventory, manufacturing, and improvement for various companies including Hawthorne Works, Manufacturing Investment Company and Madison Paper company; owner and employee portraits; advertisement for improved lighting, product assembly and testing over more than a century.
Photographer of many images was likely Marty Labno, according to Dr. Wrege.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Charles D. Wrege Collection of History of Management Photographs #6014 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Copy #12 of a limited edition 25 copies. Signed by the author. Contains original photographs; binder includes the dates 1879-1931
